meanings.definition: To place weights back in their proper location on a weightlifting rack.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his set, he made sure to rerack the dumbbells neatly.
meanings.sent2: Remember to rerack the barbells after you're done using them.
meanings.sent3: The gym rule is simple: rerack your weights or face the consequences!
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a messy weight rack, but she managed to rerack her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The clang of the weights as they rerack echoes through the gym.

meanings.definition: To rearrange items on a rack or shelf in an organized manner.
meanings.sent1: She decided to rerack the books in alphabetical order for easier access.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to rerack the products after you've finished organizing them.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper had to rerack the items after a mischievous customer messed them up.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a jumbled shelf, but she managed to rerack her thoughts neatly.
meanings.sent5: The neat rows of products on the shelf make it easy to rerack them after use.
